sense.name: a spoken or written reply to a question
sense.examples: They liked the candidate's answers to most of the debate questions. She knocked at the door and then went on in, without waiting for an answer. (implication of expected reply) Whenever Bob asked Sally for a date, her answer was always 'no'.

sense.name: a solution to a problem
sense.examples: The answers to this problem set can be found on page 192. More money by itself is not the answer to improving the school's performance. What is the answer to lasting peace in the middle east? Only two of John's answers on the test were wrong.

sense.name: the plea of a defendant to a legal charge
sense.examples: The judge asked the defendant what his answer to the charge was. He is probably discussing with his attorney what the best answer to these charges should be.

sense.name: behavior that is a reaction to something, usually nonverbal
sense.examples: His answer to everything is to get drunk. I guess we got our answer when she slammed the book down and left the room.

sense.name: something which is a match or correspondence to something else
sense.commentary: ANSWER[+relation][+role][+correspondence][+with_entity] Note: always occurs in the singular
sense.examples: The press called her Britain's answer to Marilyn Monroe. Those shows are television's answer to the news magazine.
